titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Donald Harris Papers, 1963-1964 and 2010 RL.11708
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Alexander-Greene, Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-03-11 15:49:44 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Donald Harris is a SNCC veteran and civil rights movement activist. This collection contains materials from his participation in SNCC including clippings, writings and articles, some ephemera, and other printed materials about SNCC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Donald Harris is a veteran of the civil rights movement. He joined the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee (SNCC) in 1962 and became involved with voter registration efforts in Southwest Georgia, running C.B. King's congressional campaign in 1964. In August 1963, he and several other SNCC workers were violently attacked and jailed following a mass meeting at a church in Americus, GA. He was held without bail on charges of insurrection for three months before being released on November 1st, 1963.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Donald Harris Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Donald Harris Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jasmine Alexander-Greene, Meghan Lyon, March 2019
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2018-0154

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Acquired as part of Duke's SNCC Legacy Project initiative. Additional archival collections from this initiative can be found through the library catalog.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials from Don Harris's involvement in SNCC, particularly in SNCC-led voter registration efforts in Southwest Georgia during the early 1960s. Also included are legal and media documents regarding his arrest on insurrection charges in August 1963, and a report from a 1964 trip across the African continent. Contains SNCC buttons and brochures. Acquired as part of the John Hope Franklin Research Center at Rubenstein Library.
